reviews.review_msg: He is really chill and isn't too strict with grading. The overall class average was pretty high (B+)

The most disorganized prof ever. The midterm and final were short and long answer questions of 200-300 words. His lectures were completely useless because he would go off topic all the time, so it was hard to know what was important to take notes of. The guy is nice and funny, but he was just sooo disorganized.

This was the most disorganized course I have ever taken. Brian had to delay every single assignment because he forgot to put out the guidelines. He also changed the format of the midterm 3 times including the night before the midterm. He also failed to put the final out on time (the final was take-home and two questions). Do not take this course.

he doesn't really teach anything. exams are textbook based. he is really funny (that's the only reason why i went to class) VERY easy marker. very approachable, so if you have questions, don't hesitate to ask. the assignment seems hard, but it isn't.

At least he acknowledges he goes off topic.  But overall, a medium-hard marker and a very nice, approachable guy.  The project is worth more than the midterm, no final. Better get the book, he goes off topic too much in class. He was okay.I would recommend him to ppl that prefer self-learning.

He's a very nice guy. Helpful, very clear in expectations. Only thing I can complain about is that 350 requires too much work for a 3 credit course. Bryan did not have enough time for the course or us students. He was always leaving early due to his other commitments.
